sentences.sContent: And it has been confirmed from invertebrates (like crayfish and beetles) till the anthropoid (man like) apes.
sentences.sContent_eng: And it has been confirmed from invertebrates (like crayfish and beetles) till the anthropoid (man like) apes.
sentences.sCn: 这一现象从无脊椎动物（像小龙虾和甲虫）到类人猿的动物圈子里都早已得到了证实。

sentences.sContent: If our early anthropoid ancestors had not succeeded in migrating from Asia to Africa, we simply wouldn't exist.
sentences.sContent_eng: If our early anthropoid ancestors had not succeeded in migrating from Asia to Africa, we simply wouldn't exist.
sentences.sCn: 假如我们早期的类人猿祖先没有成功地从亚洲迁移到非洲，我们就不可能存在。

sentences.sContent: From the point of view of evolution, men originated millions of years ago from the anthropoid, a species commonly referred to as the ape man.
sentences.sContent_eng: From the point of view of evolution, men originated millions of years ago from the anthropoid, a species commonly referred to as the ape man.
sentences.sCn: 从进化的观点来看，人类起源于几百万年前的类人猿，通常又称作猿人。

synos.tran: [人类]类人猿的；类人的；（猿等）似人类的

words.tran: 人为的；[人类] 人类起源的
以人类为中心的；以人类观点解释宇宙万物的
人类起源学的；人类起源的
人类本位说；人类中心说

trans.tranOther: any primate of the suborder Anthropoidea, including monkeys, apes, and man
